class.name: PIXI.RenderTexture

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the render texture

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the render texture

parameters.name: renderer
parameters.help: The renderer used for this RenderTexture

parameters.name: scaleMode
parameters.help: Should be one of the PIXI.scaleMode consts

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.help: The resolution of the texture being generated

public.name: addTextureToCache
public.help: Adds a texture to the global PIXI.TextureCache. This cache is shared across the whole PIXI object.

parameters.name: texture
parameters.help: The Texture to add to the cache.

parameters.name: id
parameters.help: The id that the texture will be stored against.

public.name: clear
public.help: Clears the RenderTexture.

public.name: destroy
public.help: Destroys this texture

parameters.name: destroyBase
parameters.help: Whether to destroy the base texture as well

public.name: fromCanvas
public.help: Helper function that creates a new a Texture based on the given canvas element.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.help: The canvas element source of the texture

parameters.name: scaleMode
parameters.help: Should be one of the PIXI.scaleMode consts

public.name: fromFrame
public.help: Helper function that returns a Texture objected based on the given frame id.\nIf the frame id is not in the texture cache an error will be thrown.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.help: The frame id of the texture

public.name: fromImage
public.help: Helper function that creates a Texture object from the given image url.\nIf the image is not in the texture cache it will be  created and loaded.

parameters.name: imageUrl
parameters.help: The image url of the texture

parameters.name: crossorigin
parameters.help: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

parameters.name: scaleMode
parameters.help: Should be one of the PIXI.scaleMode consts

public.name: getBase64

returns.help: A base64 encoded string of the texture.

public.help: Will return a a base64 encoded string of this texture. It works by calling RenderTexture.getCanvas and then running toDataURL on that.

public.name: getCanvas

returns.help: A Canvas element with the texture rendered on.

public.help: Creates a Canvas element, renders this RenderTexture to it and then returns it.

public.name: getImage
public.help: Will return a HTML Image of the texture

public.name: removeTextureFromCache
public.help: Remove a texture from the global PIXI.TextureCache.

parameters.name: id
parameters.help: The id of the texture to be removed

public.name: resize
public.help: Resizes the RenderTexture.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width to resize to.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height to resize to.

parameters.name: updateBase
parameters.help: Should the baseTexture.width and height values be resized as well?

public.name: setFrame
public.help: Specifies the region of the baseTexture that this texture will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: The frame of the texture to set it to

private.name: renderCanvas
private.help: This function will draw the display object to the texture.

parameters.name: displayObject
parameters.help: The display object to render this texture on

parameters.name: [matrix]
parameters.help: Optional matrix to apply to the display object before rendering.

parameters.name: [clear]
parameters.help: If true the texture will be cleared before the displayObject is drawn

private.name: renderWebGL
private.help: This function will draw the display object to the texture.

parameters.name: displayObject
parameters.help: The display object to render this texture on

parameters.name: [matrix]
parameters.help: Optional matrix to apply to the display object before rendering.

parameters.name: [clear]
parameters.help: If true the texture will be cleared before the displayObject is drawn

public.name: baseTexture
public.help: The base texture object that this texture uses

public.name: crop
public.help: This is the area of the BaseTexture image to actually copy to the Canvas / WebGL when rendering,\nirrespective of the actual frame size or placement (which can be influenced by trimmed texture atlases)

public.name: frame
public.help: The framing rectangle of the render texture

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the render texture

public.name: noFrame
public.help: Does this Texture have any frame data assigned to it?

public.name: renderer
public.help: The renderer this RenderTexture uses. A RenderTexture can only belong to one renderer at the moment if its webGL.

public.name: requiresUpdate
public.help: This will let a renderer know that a texture has been updated (used mainly for webGL uv updates)

public.name: resolution
public.help: The Resolution of the texture.

public.name: trim
public.help: The texture trim data.

public.name: width
public.help: The with of the render texture
